CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1955, pg. 21, reads: "MARBLES CHAMP HAILED - A goodly crowd turned out at City and County Building Monday to pay tribute to Raymond Jones Jr., 12, of 1015 North Franklin Street, who was crowned U. S. marbles champion by Mayor David L. Lawrence. Raymond won the national title at Asbury Park, N. J., last week.  Seated, left to right, with the new champ, are Mayor Lawrence and Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Jones, Sr., the boy's parents.  At the left is Councilman Paul F. Jones, talking to one of this colleagues. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of 1955 national marbles champion Raymond Jones Jr. wearing crown inscribed "Asbury Park", Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence, and Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Jones Sr., standing outside of City County Building
